文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_027_chunk1
证据片段: A variety of Zircaloy samples (standard production routine) with either uniform or nodular oxide and different oxide thicknesses were tested. These samples had been oxidized anodically in either 350°C water (up to 1000 days) or 400°C, 100 bar steam (up to 80 days) for samples with uniform oxide and in 500% high pressure steam (0.1 to 48 h).
测试类型: impedance measurements, BET surface and porosity measurements
额外性质: {"oxide_type": "uniform, nodular", "oxide_thickness_range": "different thicknesses", "open_porosity": "increases from 0.01% at 10μm to 3% at 100μm", "barrier_layer_thickness": "~30 nm in nodular oxide, several hundred nm in uniform oxide", "pore_size": "extremely small at transition", "roughness_factor": "ratio between geometrical and BET surface area", "crystallization_types": "columnar monoclinic, equiaxed tetragonal, fine equiaxed monoclinic"}

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_027_chunk2
证据片段: the average size of the pores increases from 3 to 90 nm for samples with a uniform oxide layer. Nodular oxide has a pore size of about 10 nm
额外性质: {"pore_size": "3-90 nm (uniform oxide), 10 nm (nodular oxide)", "oxide_type": "uniform and nodular"}

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_027_chunk2
证据片段: samples from Zircaloy-4 production sheets were exposed to steam (105 bar) atmospheres at 400°C. The average stress values were found to be between 200 to 900 N/mm²
额外性质: {"oxide_stress": "200-900 MPa", "oxide_stress_raw_unit": "N/mm²", "surface_treatment": "pickled and electropolished", "corrosion_rate": "increases at transition (2-2.5 μm)"}

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_027_chunk2
证据片段: crystal structure is shown in a temperature versus corrosion rate map. This figure reveals in most cases a major monoclinic structure and a minor tetragonal structure
额外性质: {"crystal_structure": "major monoclinic, minor tetragonal", "phase_composition": "tetragonal phase higher in samples with high corrosion rate"}

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_027_chunk2
证据片段: fraction of tetragonal oxide as a function of oxide layer thickness. For oxide layers formed in steam and oxygen, both data sets show a reducing fraction of tetragonal structure with increasing oxide thickness
额外性质: {"tetragonal_fraction": "decreases with increasing oxide thickness", "oxidation_environment": "steam and oxygen"}

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_027_chunk2
证据片段: half intensity width of the monoclinic (111) peak versus the oxide layer thickness. Broadness of the peak increases with decreasing crystallite size and increasing crystallite inhomogeneities
